intro: Relbunium richardianum subsp. pusillum, commonly known as the dwarf relbunium, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant typically found in alpine and subalpine regions. The subspecies is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized plant in its native range.
